citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the inspection, protocols VET 262, VET 231, and VET 135 did not include an adequate rationale for the
appropriateness of the number of animals to be used. The protocols did not include an adequate rationale such as the
number of students that would be involved or the desired student-to-animal ratio. An animal use proposal must include an
adequate rationale for the appropriateness of the numbers of animals to be used so that the IACUC can conduct a
thorough review of the components of the activities related to the care and use of animals and determine that the
proposed activities are in accordance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by ensuring that all protocols contain all
components listed in this subsection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative.
